creator: KlausRusch@atmedia.net
text:
"allow from hostname" fails with "HostNameLookups off"

The file is protected by the following directives in .htaccess:

<Files filename.html>
deny from all
allow from .example.com
</Files>

Access is still denied from clients in the example.com domain

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
This is very unlikely.  We would have heard many many bug reports
about it already.

More likely is that you have a DNS configuration problem.  Access
will only be allowed if a reverse lookup on the client IP address
gives a hostname that matches the Allow statement AND a forward
lookup on that hostname returns the original IP address.

Please double-check your configuration and try with a different
address.

creator: KlausRusch@atmedia.net
text:
The "problem" was actually a patch by the service provider 
to completely disable hostname lookups in Apache, even for 
access control. Apache without the patch is working as 
documented.
